content.description:
Sit start on thin holds and work your way up micro crimps and square edges to the top.

There are alot of holds that look good but turn out to be absolutely horrible on this one. A bit of searching around is required on this pumpy and perplexing route.
content.location: Just left of center on the steep face of the Boxcar boulder.

content.description: This climb faces the road. Start on the right arête, on a flat jug ledge and traverse leftwards. You'll encounter a slew of angled holds on your journey. Top out once near the left arête.
content.location: Sit start on right arête on the slight overhang facing the street.

content.description: Sit start and work you way up and slightly left through thin holds and big moves to a good hold topping out.
content.location: Climb just Left of the Right arete on the steep overhanging side.

content.description: A nice mix of jugs and steep pinches lead up this overhanging face to an exciting finish pulling over the top.
content.location: Climb just right of the left arete on the steep face.

content.description:
Traverse the Boxcar Woody Boulder in a Clockwise direction starting on it's Left (south) side beginning on a perfect, flat two hand rail start.

Warm up on the easy V0 wall and turn the corner to a short slabby wall to warm up the feet. Next, drop down around the corner (watch out for the barbed wire fence) and continue traversing the wall. Staying low for a pumpy sustained V2+ on big loaf pinches and crimps or head up high for a more relaxed and less steep variation. Get a good rest on some nice jugs before turning the corner and fighting your way through the last 12 ft of pumpy, sequential crimps and edges (stay low for the V5 or go high to the rim for a V1 finish) before finally pulling around the last corner and back to the start.

You can customize the traverse to make it as hard or easy as you like but staying low the whole way is the original traverse.

When you get it wired, give yourself a challenge and see how many times you can make it around without falling off.
Climb the left arete of the roadside face of the boulder.  Crux is the bottom and it gets easier up higher.
content.location: Left arete of the roadside face of the boulder.
